column4: Do linksys wifi cards work in linux, without ndiswrapper or using the restricted drive manager?
it depends in the "chipset" not the generic brand name
ok well can you reccomend one?
mmm... no you are wrong. Broadcom work, but not at full 54 Mbps, they may work okay at 11Mbps
incorrect. I have a bc card. You either need ndiswrapper or you need to use fw-cutter/wl-apasta, which work really poorly
they definitely aren't plug and play
well I've talked to numerous broadcom users, and there is the bcm43xx module so I recommend it, but I don't own one so I don't know from personal experience.
yes the bcm43xx module doesnt work without he firmware
obviously, but that is the point to use both the firmware and the module, so it may not be such a big complication after all.
right but the firmware isnt included. i.e. its not just plug it in and it works
mmm... Is bcm43xx-fwcutter included in the CD?
for my wifi card? No. Its built into my laptop. And it doesnt matter. This isnt about my card!
the cd for what? My wifi card?
oh. Not sure but I dont think so
